nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.glyphs

Class ArrowStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.glyphs.Glyph
      • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.glyphs.ArrowStyle

  • public abstract class ArrowStyle
extends Glyph
    Glyphs that can be used to style arrowheads, either in forward or backward direction. The basic shape of the glyph should point in the right (1,0) direction. By default, arrow glyphs follow the stroke of the render context, in both color and width.

      • represent

        public BaseGeometry represent(Vector position,
                              Vector direction,
                              double size)
        Instantiates this glyph for a given location with a desired direction and size.
        Parameters:
        position - position to place the origin of the basic shape at
        direction - direction for the arrow
        size - scale factor for the basic shape
        Returns:
        newly constructed geometry to represent the point

      • getStrokeWidthMode

        public GlyphStrokeWidthMode getStrokeWidthMode()
        Description copied from class: Glyph
        Returns the desired way of setting the strokewidth for the glyph. Only has effect if getStrokeMode does not return CLEAR.
